headline: Barnes posts $1.7M first quarter number in Wisconsin Senate race
author: Julia Manchester
sentences: A Marquette University Law School survey released earlier this month showed Barnes leading the Democratic field of candidates, with 23 percent support, followed by Milwaukee Bucks executive Alex Lasry at 13 percent support.

Mandela Barnes' unparalleled fundraising momentum continued this quarter with a haul that shows how much excitement there is for this campaign in every corner of the state,? McDaniel said in a statement.

The Cook Political Report rates the state's Senate race as a toss-up.?
Barnes's campaign said the total was made up of more than 28,000 total donors and nearly 44,000 individual donors.
Barnes's communications director, Maddy McDaniel, said the success was evidence of the lieutenant governor's momentum in the Senate primary.
The Hill has removed its comment section, as there are many other forums for readers to participate in the conversation.
Mandela Barnes (D) announced on Tuesday he raised $1.7 million for his Senate campaign during the first quarter of 2022.
Notably, 48 percent of respondents gave no preference, leaving room for movement ahead of the state's Aug. 9 primary.
Barnes is part of a crowded Democratic primary field hoping to take on incumbent Sen. Ron Johnson (R) in November.
According to his campaign, the latest haul marks the most raised in a quarter by any candidate in the race.
Nelson trailed at 5 percent, and Wisconsin state Treasurer Sarah Godlewski came in at 3 percent support.
The first quarter number surpassed the $1.23 million Barnes raised in the fourth quarter of 2021.
The average donation was under $40, according to the campaign.
